summary: Build an app similar to Firefly 3: a personal finance tracker for managing accounts, recording transactions, and viewing spending.
architectural_notes: Future features should be implemented modularly (as separable modules/segments per feature, e.g., Budgets/Goals/Reports as independently deliverable units).
User requested next priorities: Bulk editing (AR-10), Tags (AR-11), and CSV import/export (AR-12).
known_issues: Automated build failed with generic error ('AI was unable to implement your request') when attempting to generate the Budgets feature/module.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and sign-out, and scope all finance data to the currently authenticated user (Principal).
Build the core UI screens for a Firefly 3-like workflow: Dashboard (overview), Accounts, Transactions, Categories, and Settings.
Implement transaction creation/editing UX that supports income, expense, and transfers, with validation and helpful defaults.
Add a spending overview dashboard with charts and quick stats (current month income/expense, net, and top categories).

Add initial visual design direction and apply it consistently across the app (layout, typography, spacing, and component styling). Choose a distinctive theme appropriate for a personal finance product without using a blue/purple primary palette.
Add React Query hooks in the frontend to call the new Budgets backend APIs (fetch monthly budgets, upsert/delete budget limits, fetch monthly budget summaries).
Create a new Budgets screen that lets the user select a month, set per-category monthly limits, and view budget status (spent/remaining/carryover) for that month.
Add Budgets to the main navigation so it appears alongside Dashboard, Accounts, Transactions, Categories, and Settings.
Add a Tags data model scoped to the authenticated caller (Principal), and allow each transaction to be associated with zero or more tags in addition to its category.
Add a bulk editing workflow in the Transactions screen to enable fast cleanup: multi-select transactions, review selection count, and apply bulk actions.
Add CSV export for transactions (and any required related fields) and make it downloadable from the frontend without routing files through the backend.
Add CSV import for transactions to enable adding many transactions at once, with validation feedback and a clear success summary.
Add a new Bank Connections module that lets an authenticated user create, view, and remove bank connections, scoped to the current Internet Identity Principal.
Implement a UI-driven transaction sync workflow for each bank connection, including a manual “Sync now” action and visible sync status (idle/in progress/last synced/last error).

Provide an initial built-in “Mock Bank” provider that simulates downloading transaction history and imports transactions into existing Accounts/Categories/Transactions so the full end-to-end bank sync UX can be tested without external bank APIs.
Add navigation and routing for the Bank Connections screen so it appears alongside the existing main sections (Dashboard, Accounts, Transactions, Categories, Budgets, Settings).
Add React Query hooks to call the new Bank Connections backend APIs (list connections, create/delete, sync, and refresh relevant cached data after sync).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Firefly 3-like personal finance tracker app (accounts, transactions, spending overview).
Create backend data models and canister APIs to manage personal finance data: accounts, categories, transactions, and summary queries.
Add Budgets module: monthly budgets, per-category limits, and rollover logic (implemented as a modular feature).
Add Goals module: savings targets with progress tracking (modular).
Add Recurring schedules module: create recurring transactions (monthly/yearly) with automation (modular).
Add Alerts module: low-balance and high-spending notifications (modular).
Add Advanced reports module: trends, comparisons, and custom date ranges (modular).
Add Net-worth module: assets minus liabilities view over time (modular).
Add Bulk editing module: fast cleanup/editing of multiple transactions (modular).
Add Tags module: transaction labeling beyond categories (modular).
Add CSV import/export module for transactions/accounts (modular).
Add Shared accounts/household mode module: shared access to selected accounts (modular).
Add a new Budgets data model to the Motoko backend, scoped per authenticated caller (Principal), supporting monthly budgets with per-category limits and rollover tracking between months.
Implement backend canister APIs for Budgets CRUD and budget-month summary computation (spent, remaining, rollover/carryover) per category for a selected month.

If adding Budgets state changes the upgrade-stable layout, add/adjust backend/migration.mo so existing user data (profiles, accounts, categories, transactions) is preserved across canister upgrades while initializing the new Budgets state safely.
Implement backend transaction update and delete capabilities (single and bulk) needed for fast transaction cleanup, including safe authorization and ownership validation per caller.
Add bank connections module: allow users to connect to banks and automatically download/sync transaction history via a UI-driven workflow.
